tweets.html:
"Upcoming Hangover 3" are terrible words to hear in the morning. #GoldenGlobes

— Kate Aurthur (@KateAurthur) December 13, 2012

SMASH WAS NOMINATED HA HA HA HA HA.

— Kate Aurthur (@KateAurthur) December 13, 2012

Golden Globe nominee for Outstanding Series, "Smash." I wake up at 4:45 for this. #bleep

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) December 13, 2012

Am I drunk or was Hayden Panettiere seriously nominated for a #GoldenGlobe in the same category as Maggie Smith? What is life?

— Richie (@RichieOnTV) December 13, 2012

I love the Golden Globes every year. They're the only award show informed solely by observing other award shows.

— Libby Hill (@midwestspitfire) December 13, 2012

Remember: The Globes' TV categories make the most sense if you assume the voters have read only the first half of an Entertainment Weekly.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) December 13, 2012

It's going to be hard to beat the 'Salmon Fishing in the Yemen' juggernaut.

— Kate Aurthur (@KateAurthur) December 13, 2012

all the salmon fishing in the yemen jokes are going to come back with a vengeance

— Person of Mattress (@digifreak642) December 13, 2012

The Globes evidently have room for only one AMC drama at a time.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) December 13, 2012

Newsroom instead of Mad Men is the thing you're going to be mad about today. Go ahead and start.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) December 13, 2012

The Newsroom is the new Pia Zadora. #goldenglobes

— Meredith Blake (@MeredithBlake) December 13, 2012

People, I have a hard time taking ANY awards seriously. But *the Golden Globes TV* noms? Like the ceremony, merely an excuse to drink.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) December 13, 2012

Mock the HFPA all you want -- they're morons -- but they didn't nominate Lindsay Lohan for "Liz and Dick."

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) December 13, 2012

NO MAD MEN? THE GOLDEN GLOBES ARE THE WORST! RABBLE RABBLE RABBLE! @EveryTweet_Ever

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) December 13, 2012

Having said that, what the hell _is_ up with the no Mad Men, Golden Globes?

— Poe Daar-meron (@AndrewDaar) December 13, 2012

@zhandlen Snub Mad Men? Fine! It appeared in very few Entertainment Weeklys this year. But Newsroom?! No.

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) December 13, 2012

I'm gonna waste the rest of my morning analyzing the motives of a group that doesn't think "Mad Men" is one of TV's 5 best dramas?!?

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) December 13, 2012

LAURA DERN OR BUST.

— pilot (@pilotbacon) December 13, 2012

@pilotbacon she shoulda gone salmon fishing in that yemen

— David Sims (@davidlsims) December 13, 2012

Oh and your HFPA math: Danny Huston > Aaron Paul. This is an ungodly waste of my morning.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) December 13, 2012

Is it inappropriate for the Golden Globes to nominate itself as Best Musical/Comedy? Because its nominations are always hilarious.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) December 13, 2012

Having any reaction at all to Golden Globes nominations strikes me as playing into their hands. #upearlyforotherreasons

— Robert Lloyd (@LATimesTVLloyd) December 13, 2012

I SURE HOPE "MODERN FAMILY" FINALLY GOT THE RECOGNITION IT DESERVES

— pilot (@pilotbacon) December 13, 2012

#MadMen's reign has ended - no Best Series #GoldenGlobe nod. Will we continue to blame Megan?

— Jarett Wieselman (@JarettSays) December 13, 2012

#Smash is up for best comedy or musical at the #GoldenGlobes? Well, it definitely qualifies as both.

— TVWithoutPity (@TVWithoutPity) December 13, 2012

You think you're ready for the dumb Globes nominations, and then Smash and The Newsroom beat actual good shows and it's STILL ANNOYING.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) December 13, 2012

It's an outrage! (You may save this tweet and retweet whenever you feel it's applicable.)

— Mark Harris (@MarkHarrisNYC) December 13, 2012

I just pulled up a photo with a caption that starts "Blake Lively addresses...," so I closed it.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) December 13, 2012

At least Girls can't be blamed for the Mad Men snub.

— Alexa Planje (@HerQueue) December 13, 2012

*insert pretend outrage over #GoldenGlobes nominations here*

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) December 13, 2012

My favorite head-to-head competition: Costner vs. Cumberbatch, which means all my fanfic is finally coming true! #GoldenGlobes

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) December 13, 2012

Theory: the HFPA got a screener copy of #Smash where the only scene on the disc that wasn't corrupted was "Let's Be Bad."

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) December 13, 2012

The Golden Globes can do whatever they want in the knowledge that we'll all still be watching for Tina Fey and Amy Poehler.

— Grace (@GemOfAmara) December 13, 2012

All of our salmon fishing in the Yemen jokes have finally paid off

— Peter Labuza (@labuzamovies) December 13, 2012

I think of the Golden Globes as a conscious entity: a raging raging 56 year-old drunk who tips badly and leers at the waitresses.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) December 13, 2012

POC at #GoldenGlobes count. Ready? Here we go: Denzel and Don and Sofia and Archie and Ang. That's it. 5. Bless your hearts.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) December 13, 2012

Guys, it's perfectly fitting that the Golden Globes, an awards ceremony people hate-watch, have nominated Smash, a drama people hate-watch.

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) December 13, 2012

A reminder to the TVitterati: #GoldenGlobes are like a naughty toddler. Paying them any kind of attention only encourages their behavior.

— Jason Mittell (@jmittell) December 13, 2012

Most logical explanation for GG noms for "Smash" and "The Newsroom" is that the HFPA likes to hate-watch.

— Rick Porter (@rickporter) December 13, 2012

Apparently the #GoldenGlobes bar has been open for weeks now already.

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) December 13, 2012

Damn you HFPA for giving being foreign a bad reputation. I promise I'm not like them, TV community. #MadMenSnub #GoldenGlobes

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) December 13, 2012

Once again @TheSoup snubbed from Golden Globes. Even though last night we had decency to bleep the word "fingers" in "2 fingers inside her."

— Matthew Carney (@matthewcarney) December 13, 2012

Michelle Dockery's got a Golden Globe nomination? What for, Best Inanimate Washboard in a Period Drama?

— Paul Whitelaw (@paulwhitelaw) December 13, 2012

If Matt dies tonight (ever) I am not responsible for my actions. #TVD

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) December 13, 2012

@TVandDinners We all die.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) December 13, 2012

I'm convinced though that ESPN needs to incorporate lie detector tests in their debate programming. Kick things up a notch.

— Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) December 13, 2012

Before I open box that seems to be from #TheFollowing I'd like to know there's not a human head inside. Because size is about right. #fox

— Ellen Gray (@elgray) December 13, 2012

A man in England collapsed and died while dancing to Gangnam Style. His dancing was described as "inaccurate."

— Chase Mitchell (@ChaseMit) December 13, 2012

TLC's year-end specials give you an idea of the shit even TLC was afraid to order as a series, i.e. "Best Funeral Ever."

— Brian Lowry (@blowryontv) December 13, 2012

TLC's plan to air "The Best Funeral Ever" might mean it has run out of living people to exploit, so maybe TLC is on the verge of implosion?

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) December 13, 2012

Just saw a trailer for The Carrie Diaries and thinking which other characters deserve a prequel? I'd like a kindergarten Saved By the Bell

— Daniel Bettridge (@DanielBettridge) December 13, 2012

Adam Brody joining House of Lies as Kristen Bell's love interest might get me to watch. My Seth Cohen/Veronica Mars fanfic is happening.

— ultralight meme (@GDS3000) December 14, 2012

I like when Alex gives a shocked "oh no" after a response as if to say "what the hell were you thinking?" #Jeopardy

— Mike McComb (@Rube_Goldberg) December 14, 2012

I am reasonably certain I own the same suit Freddie's wearing in this week's #TheHour. Now where can I find that head of hair to match?

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) December 14, 2012

Dear #BestBuy, All the billboards in the world will not convince me that Dragon Naturally Speaking is THE gift this Christmas.

— Robin Ewing (@robinlewing) December 14, 2012

I've started watching this thing called TV recently. Did you guys know family is important?

— Alexa Planje (@HerQueue) December 14, 2012

@HerQueue Breakfast.

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) December 14, 2012

You guys were not kidding about AMERICAN HORROR STORY season 2 being boooonnkkeeerrrrsss.

— Ken! The Herald Angels Sing (@kenlowery) December 14, 2012

What Would Mandy Patinkin Do

— Annie Stamell (@stamos) December 14, 2012

@adamfairholm I love that one! Not lying.

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) December 14, 2012

@adamfairholm Gladly! And everybody knows she belongs with the guy who lives in her building.

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) December 14, 2012

Guy sitting next to me on the bus is watching Frasier on his iPhone. Can't decide if this restores or destroys my faith in humanity.

— Stefanie Lee (@stefaside) December 14, 2012

You know you're getting old when you want to be Batman because he has someone who brings him tea in bed

— will brooker (@willbrooker) December 14, 2012

Tv shows are a bit like american idol; no we don't want the consistent performer we want most improved because it plays on our expectations

— E (@boltsandballs) December 14, 2012

There's an "X Factor" spoiler, but if you don't care, Britney's face is AWESOME. RT @yaysarcasm: Here's the gif http://t.co/S7qDloTR

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) December 14, 2012

This is one of the less enjoyable Howie Mandel broadcast TV game shows I've seen.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) December 14, 2012

Does NBC have a machine that churns out generic, baffling game shows? Also, why are the #TakeItAll prizes illustrated with clip art?

— Andy Dehnart (@realityblurred) December 14, 2012

Lettermen forced to interview Julie Chen, aka the boss' wife. No matter what your job, there's always room to eat a little sh*t.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) December 14, 2012

Had a dream I was live tweeting an episode of #TVD that I was actually in. So, that happened. (Also? Stefan is a big jerk face.)

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) December 13, 2012

"You want to come?" Now is not the best time to ask Damon questions like that, Elena. #TVD

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) December 14, 2012

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
I...don't think that's a normal tank top. #TVD

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) December 14, 2012

I #Parenthood cried at the end of #TVD tonight.

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) December 14, 2012

I finally finished #tvd and I'll say, it's the most anti-Crismus episode I've ever seen. Kudos for the darkness!

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) December 14, 2012

Observation: #TVD appropriately went with a cover of Judy Garland's "Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas," which is sadder than Frank's.

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) December 14, 2012

This holiday ep of Glee is so saccharine, like usual. Needs Murder Santa.

— Alexa Planje (@HerQueue) December 14, 2012

tweets.author_name: Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There
tweets.html:
NYADA is the only performing arts school in the entire world. #GLEE

— Moved on Her Like a Bitch but Couldn't Get There (@AmandaAnnKlein) December 14, 2012

We need Drunk Will all the time. #glee

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) December 14, 2012

Burt Hummel is a national treasure. #glee

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) December 14, 2012

Ok, Mike O’Malley instantly makes any #Glee episode better… but why is he always in some form of mortal peril?

— Tim (@rural_juror) December 14, 2012

So, everyone else who realized Blaine and Kurt did the Michael Buble/Shania Twain version of "White Christmas," raise your hand. #Glee

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) December 14, 2012

Goddamit #glee, Burt Hummel really is the best thing you've ever done. Thanks for making me cry, jackasses.

— Hannah Ellison (@hanellison) December 14, 2012

Everyone, in a few minutes I will be participating in the #blacktwitter event known as #scandal. Look away until further notice.

— Tressie Mc (@tressiemcphd) December 14, 2012

Y'all #blacktwitter is ab to break it all up in here. To borrow from TD Jakes: Get ready get ready get ready. #scandal http://t.co/0i6OujN3

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) December 14, 2012

Why, dammit! WHY?!?!??? #Scandal #AskScandal

— Mark O. Estes (@theanticritic) December 14, 2012

I'm telling y'all, @shondarhimes has dropped her mic in America's living room and sashayed out with a "You will deal." #askscandal

— A Midairs Nor (@morris_d) December 14, 2012

You know it's a good show when everyone from your kindergarten classmates, all the way to your Pastor are all watching #Scandal #WhatTheHUCK

— Christina Mitchell (@MzMochaMitchell) December 14, 2012

Have I told you lately how much I hate Quinn? Bc I do. In fact, I wish they'd left her ungrateful overly inquisitive ass in jail. #scandal

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) December 14, 2012

If Shonda pulls a Denny and kills Fitz I'm going to... do something. I'm not sure what, but it will be major. #Scandal

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) December 14, 2012

You cannot watch #Scandal then go straight to bed. My blood pressure too high. Ain't nobody got time for that

— Jasamine Stewart (@MzJazzyBaby28) December 14, 2012

That loud thud on the southside of Chicago was me fainting courtesy of Shonda Rhimes #Scandal

— Alicia (@5ft9dreamgirl) December 14, 2012

#Scandal is going to kill me.

— ronald isley (@yoyotrav) December 14, 2012

Google is about to be flooded with questions like this: what is the patriot act? #scandal

— Sheryl Deette (@Hazel_Browns) December 14, 2012

REALLY?!?!?! How DARE ABC and Shonda leave us like this!! I'm about to write a strongly worded letter in red ink and bold font! #Scandal

— John Momon III (@jwillmuziq83) December 14, 2012

#Scandal just gave me life, then bitch-slapped me with it before taking it away until January 10th. #AskScandal

— Mark O. Estes (@theanticritic) December 14, 2012

Scandal > Homeland

— Elana Levine (@ehl) December 14, 2012

Seeing people tweet about #Scandal makes me wonder what it would be like if Twitter were around when #Lost first started. *low whistle*

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) December 14, 2012

#Scandal just scared me more than any horror movie I have ever seen. Including Alien when I was 11.

— Cameron White (@JediDusk) December 14, 2012

WTF Scandal? #ThursdayNightTweets

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) December 14, 2012

So many feelings about #Scandal. Need Shonda to write them out for me in deeply felt eloquent whispers.

— ishira kumar (@ishirakumar) December 14, 2012
